title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Design a zoo system using all OOP concepts!

1. INTERFACE 'IFeedable': void Feed()
2. ABSTRACT CLASS 'Animal': string Name, int Age, abstract void MakeSound()
3. DERIVED 'Lion' : Animal, IFeedable: override MakeSound() to 'Roar!', implement Feed()
4. DERIVED 'Penguin' : Animal, IFeedable: override MakeSound() to 'Squawk!', implement Feed()
5. Create array of Animals, call MakeSound() polymorphically
6. Create array of IFeedable, call Feed() on all

Demonstrate: inheritance, abstraction, interfaces, polymorphism!

hints.text: Combine concepts: abstract class for shared template, interface for behavior contract, override for polymorphism. Use base type arrays for polymorphic operations.
Overusing inheritance: Don't create deep hierarchies (Animal → Mammal → Carnivore → Feline → Lion). Keep it simple! 2-3 levels max.
Interface vs Abstract confusion: If NO shared implementation, use interface. If SOME shared code, use abstract class. Both? Use abstract class with interfaces!
Forgetting polymorphism benefit: The power is storing different types in same array (Animal[]) and calling methods. Each object responds differently!
Inheritance for code reuse only: Don't inherit just to reuse code! Use composition (has-a) or helper classes instead. Inherit when there's true IS-A relationship.
